meanings.definition: To assign a lower rating or score to something.
meanings.sent1: She was downrating the movie because she didn't like the ending.
meanings.sent2: The teacher decided to downrate the assignment due to missing information.
meanings.sent3: The cat downrated the new toy by ignoring it completely.
meanings.sent4: The storm downrated the once beautiful garden to a muddy mess.
meanings.sent5: The chef downrated the dish for being too salty.

meanings.definition: The act of giving a lower rating or score to something.
meanings.sent1: The downrating of the product led to a decrease in sales.
meanings.sent2: Her downrating of the restaurant was based on poor service.
meanings.sent3: The downrating of the book made the author rethink their writing style.
meanings.sent4: The downrating of the team's performance was a wake-up call for improvement.
meanings.sent5: The downrating of the hotel was reflected in the online reviews.
